meanings.definition: To have learned something to an excessive degree.
meanings.sent1: She overlearned the dance routine and could perform it perfectly.
meanings.sent2: He overlearned the multiplication table and could recite it backwards.
meanings.sent3: The cat overlearned how to open the treat jar and now helps itself whenever it pleases.
meanings.sent4: His mind overlearned the song lyrics, and they played on repeat in his head.
meanings.sent5: The student overlearned the history facts, making them stick in their memory forever.

meanings.definition: Having learned something to an excessive degree.
meanings.sent1: The overlearned student aced every test without studying.
meanings.sent2: She felt overlearned in the subject, having studied it for years.
meanings.sent3: The overlearned chef could cook the dish blindfolded.
meanings.sent4: His overlearned knowledge of the topic impressed the professor.
meanings.sent5: The overlearned pianist played the piece flawlessly, without a single mistake.
